qas.question: Who was the founder of the Arena Football League?
What was the inaugural year of the AFL?
Where does the Arena Football League rank amongst professional football leagues in North America by longevity?
In yards, how large is an arena football field?
What fraction of the size of an NFL football field is an arena football field?

context: The Arena Football League (AFL) is the highest level of professional indoor American football in the United States. It was founded in <a1_0>1987<a1_0/> by <a0_0>Jim Foster<a0_0/>, making it the <a2_0>third<a2_0/> longest-running professional football league in North America, after the Canadian Football League and the National Football League. It is played indoors on a <a3_0>68<a3_0/>-yard field (about <a4_0>half<a4_0/> the distance of an NFL field), resulting in a faster-paced and higher-scoring game. The sport was invented in the early 1980s and patented by Foster, a former executive of the United States Football League and the National Football League.
